summary: This is a confidential settlement letter submitted by the law firm Panish Shea & Boyle to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program on behalf of a claimant (referred to as 'Jane Doe' in a lawsuit). The letter details the claimant's history of being sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell over 200 times from age 14, across multiple locations, and presents evidence including witness statements, flight logs, and a video testimonial to support a $75 million settlement demand.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary accused child sex abuser who allegedly sexually abused and raped the claimant over 200 times between the ages of 14 and 18. He committed suicide in jail on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Accused of assisting, facilitating, and personally participating in the sexual abuse of the claimant. She is facing federal charges and was in jail at the time of the letter.

persons.name: Jordana H. Feldman
persons.context: The administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to whom this confidential settlement letter is addressed.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney from Panish Shea & Boyle LLP who signed the settlement letter.

persons.name: Lynn Ponton
persons.role: Professor Emeritus of Child & Adolescent Psychiatry
persons.context: Professor at University of California, San Francisco who provided commentary in a video testimonial regarding the claimant's abuse and damages.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who, in October 2003, sent a threatening letter to the claimant demanding repayment of approximately $10,000 for back rent on a New York apartment.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Worked for Epstein between 1991 and 2002. Provided a sworn declaration recalling the claimant visiting Epstein's Palm Beach estate and testified in a 2009 deposition about her.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Epstein's pilot starting in 1991. Provided sworn declaration and flight logs showing the claimant as a passenger on Epstein's plane in 1996, 1997, and 2001.

connections.description: Partners in a criminal enterprise of child sexual abuse; Maxwell assisted, facilitated, and participated in Epstein's abuse of the claimant.
Alessi worked for Epstein from 1991 to 2002, performing duties including maintenance at Epstein's Palm Beach estate.
Visoski worked as a pilot for Epstein starting in 1991 and provided flight logs for Epstein's plane.
Indyke acted as Epstein's attorney, sending a threatening demand letter to the claimant in 2003.
Indyke, as Epstein's attorney, was involved in legal matters connected to Maxwell's co-conspiracy with Epstein.

events.title: Claimant Meets Epstein and Maxwell
events.description: The 13-year-old claimant first met Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at a summer camp.

events.title: Period of Sexual Abuse
events.description: The claimant was sexually abused and raped by Epstein over 200 times in Palm Beach, New York, New Mexico, and Los Angeles, with Maxwell's participation.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on federal charges for sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in his jail cell while facing federal charges.

events.title: Settlement Demand Submission
events.description: Attorneys for the claimant submitted a confidential settlement demand of $50M against the Epstein Estate and $25M against Maxwell to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

events.title: Threatening Demand Letter
events.description: Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, sent a FedEx letter to the claimant demanding repayment of approximately $10,000 for back rent on a New York apartment.

locations: Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's home on El Brillo Way)
Zorro Ranch, south of Santa Fe, New Mexico
keyFacts: The claimant alleges she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein over 200 times between the ages of 14 and 18, with Ghislaine Maxwell's active participation.
The claimant is identified in the document as potentially the first known sex abuse minor victim of Epstein and Maxwell, used as a 'guinea pig' to refine their criminal enterprise.
Evidence submitted includes sworn declarations from Epstein employees (Juan Alessi, Larry Visoski), flight logs showing the claimant on Epstein's plane, and a video testimonial.
A separate $75 million settlement demand ($50M from Epstein Estate, $25M from Maxwell) was made prior to this VCP submission.
The claimant's identity was uncovered in documents seized from Epstein's home after his 2008 arrest and she is identified as 'Jane Doe 1' in the government's indictment against Maxwell.
